intro: Hieracium eriphalioides, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky areas, thriving in cool, high-altitude environments. It produces small yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
